usefulItems: large bowl, kitchen towel, silicone bread mat, baking paper, 2 large baking trays, rolling pin, pastry brush, oven
title: Brioche buns with cheese

ingredients.content: 500 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
1 egg yolk, (reserve egg white for filling)

preparations.content: Place milk, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and warm <b>2 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 1<b>.
Add all remaining brioche ingredients and knead <b>3 min/<b>. Transfer dough into a large bowl, cover with kitchen towel and leave to prove until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).

Preheat oven to 200°C. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or lightly floured work surface. Roll dough into a log (approx. 35 cm long), then divide into 14 equal portions.
Using a rolling pin, roll each portion into a circle (approx. 8 cm). Transfer onto prepared baking trays and leave to prove for a further 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg, sugar and vanilla sugar into mixing bowl and cook <b>2 min/60°C/speed 3<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>.
Add ricotta or quark and sour cream and mix <b>15 sec/speed 6<b>, with aid of spatula.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat mixing <b>15 sec/speed 6<b>.
Make an indentation in the centre of each bun with your thumb to create a nest shape. Place 2 tablespoons (approx. 40 g) of the cheese filling into each indentation.
Brush buns with beaten egg white, then bake for 15-20 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Leave buns to cool before serving.
